AboutUs.subtitle: Bee the Change. Code the Future.
AboutUs.tagline: Bringing Quebec’s biggest hackathon to life.
AboutUs.card1: This is your hub for all things hacking. From upcoming hackathons and events to curated learning resources, this site is your launchpad to grow your skills, meet fellow builders, and bring your ideas to life.
AboutUs.card2: Meet the buzzing minds building Quebec’s biggest student hackathon. HackConcordia is a student-led tech community at Concordia University.
AboutUs.card3: Ready to dive in? Whether you want to compete in a hackathon, attend a workshop, or just meet some like-minded tech lovers, HackConcordia has a spot for you.

slide1.title: ConUHacks - The hackathon experience
slide1.subtitle: A student-run, 24-hour hackathon that champions learning-by-building. ConUHacks brings together developers, designers, and curious minds to prototype, learn from mentors, and launch ideas — growing each year in scale, community, and ambition.

slide10.title: ConUHacks IX - The Next Frontier (2025)
slide10.subtitle: The ninth edition (Feb 1–2, 2025) attracted ~800 participants—the largest yet—and boasted 143 project submissions, heightened mentorship, and dedicated hands-on hardware spaces to elevate innovation.

1.description: A voice controlled custom slides editor, powered by generative AI. Create your presentation deck hands-free, with our in-house slides editor.

2.description: LeetCode, but you explain code instead of writing code.

3.description: Ever lost something precious and wished you had a digital detective on your side? Meet 404 Lost&Found – your AI-powered personal item finder and data visualization tool.

slide9.title: ConUHacks VIII - Uncharted Territories (2024)
slide9.subtitle: 2024 celebrated exploration into areas like civic tech, sustainability, and hardware-first prototypes, with stronger community buzz and interdisciplinary collaboration.

1.description: Do you have trouble waking up in the morning? Do you press snooze one too many times? If so, this productivity tool is for you, it will eliminate all laziness and lost time in your morning routine.

3.description: Avada Kedavra! Join our hand-controlled wizard in his fight against endless enemies!

slide8.title: ConUHacks VII - Breaking Boundaries (2023)
slide8.subtitle: After virtual editions during the pandemic, ConUHacks returned in-person Jan 21–22 2023 with 523 participants on Devpost but ~800 attendees overall—reigniting energy through workshops, mentors, tours, and connection.

1.description: NearbyNow is a service that detects storefronts and provides useful information such as opening hours, website, menu, reviews, etc. using a live camera feed.

2.description: Revolutionize your job interview prep with our app. Simulate real-life behavioral & technical interviews in natural conversation for personalized practice. Land your dream job.

3.description: An elegant AI that generates a chord progression/bassline based on a user-input melody.

slide7.title: ConUHacks VI - Innovation Unleashed (2022)
slide7.subtitle: 2022 leaned into rapid prototyping and experimentation: teams embraced ML/AI and maker-hardware, reinforcing the hackathon’s reputation as a space for shipping bold MVPs quickly.

1.description: Are you tired of written online reviews? Introducing RevYou, an application that allows you to not only post entertaining videos attached to locations, but also post video reviews.

2.description: Access the web via SMS - even without internet!

3.description: Decreasing furniture, clothing, and electronic waste one item at a time.

slide6.title: ConUHacks V - A New Era (2020)
slide6.subtitle: 2020 drew 700+ participants, massive application numbers, and 49 sponsors, signaling a shift toward startup thinking—helping teams envision projects beyond the 24-hour sprint.

1.description: The new gen LeapFrog: An interactive learning tool designed for reading texts aloud and translation.

2.description: Home of the Heart Hero! This is an online education platform for a modern work environment leveraging IoT, hardware, AI and gamification.

3.description: AR tower defence game using the ARcore framework and Unity Engine.

slide5.title: ConUHacks IV - The Future Awaits (2019)
slide5.subtitle: The 2019 edition welcomed ~700 students and over $20K–$25K in prizes. Projects tackled real-world needs—including accessibility-focused hacks—marking maturation in mentoring and project impact.

2.description: Keep track of your food items and receive recipe recommendations to reduce food waste based on expiration dates.

3.description: What if your waste bin sorts it out for you?

slide4.title: ConUHacks III - The Evolution Continues (2018)
slide4.subtitle: 2018 brought higher participation, increased sponsor involvement, and a growing prize pool—marking a refinement phase where polished presentations and improved mentorship became more common.

1.description: Alice aims to empower elderly people that currently suffer dementia and wish to utilize online banking.

2.description: Letting you know your loved ones are safe, wherever you are.

3.description: A web app dashboard helping elders with their reminders on the Amazon Echo.

slide3.title: ConUHacks II - The Next Chapter (2017)
slide3.subtitle: With ConUHacks II, the community expanded—more teams, broader institutional support, and a growing diversity of participants signaled the hackathon finding its stride.

3.description: Improve your speech with this app.

slide2.title: ConUHacks I - A Journey Begins (2016)
slide2.subtitle: The inaugural MLH-affiliated ConUHacks in Jan 2016 brought 250+ students together for a 24-hour buildathon—planting the community roots and traditions that fueled the hackathon’s growth over the next decade.

1.description: Accompaniyig your videos with smart context so you can further research topics mentioned in your video.

2.description: A wireless and cost effective solution using an Android app and a Myo for ASL to speech translation (bilingual).

3.description: Instantly add filters to your Facebook profile picture to support charities and local events.

faqs.heading: Bee Curious?
faqs.description: Find answers to questions about HackConcordia and ConUHacks. Need more details? Reach out to our team to know more.

questions.question1: What is ConUHacks & who organizes it?
questions.answer1: ConUHacks (hosted by HackConcordia at Concordia University) is Quebec’s largest 24‑hour student hackathon. Teams build software or hardware projects using emerging tech like AI and IoT, and demo them live to judges.
questions.answer2: Anyone above the legal age of majority—high school senior to university student is welcome. Recent graduates and international students can participate too; proof of enrollment may be required.
questions.answer3: Yes—each team can have up to 4 members. If you register solo, you’ll be listed as “Looking for Teammates”, and organizers’ll help you join a team.
questions.question4: I’m not a coder—can I still hack?
questions.answer4: Absolutely! ConUHacks welcomes newcomers—electricians, artists, designers, business majors—you name it. Our mentor teams help turn ideas into demos.
questions.answer5: No - ConUHacks is completely free, with food, swag, and workshops included.
questions.question6: Are meals, hardware, or Wi‑Fi provided?
questions.answer6: Yes! Free catered meals, snacks, and drinks are provided. There’s also a fully-equipped hardware lab with equipment and tools, plus on-site Wi‑Fi.
questions.answer7: ConUHacks typically offers prizes worth over $6 000‑$17 000 CAD—including PS5s, VR gear, Oculus headsets, gaming monitors, Amazon gift cards, plus MLH winner ribbons and interview fast‑track interviews.
questions.question8: How do I submit my project and what are judging criteria?
questions.answer8: Submit via Devpost before the deadline. Judges score based on working demo, presentation, UI/UX, creativity, and impact.
questions.question9: Is there a code of conduct?
questions.answer9: Yes—ConUHacks uses Major League Hacking’s code of conduct: inclusive and respectful community only, zero tolerance for harassment.
questions.question10: How can I get help if I have questions or concerns?
questions.answer10: During the event, visit the info booth or raise issues via Discord. For post‑event inquiries or concerns, email the hackathon manager (listed on Devpost).

faqs.reach_out: Reach out via email or follow us on social media @HackConcordia.

ContactUs.subtitle: Have questions about HackConcordia or ConuHacks? Want to be a sponsor? Want to be a judge?
